_description: Jekyll-based portfolio website with animated particles background and modern build tools
name: particle
description: AI Product Manager portfolio website with interactive particles background
_scripts_comment: Available npm/yarn scripts for development and building

scripts._dev_comment: Run 'gulp' or 'npx gulp' to start development server with live reload
scripts._build_comment: Run 'gulp sass' and 'gulp js' to build assets, then 'jekyll build' to generate site

author: Insha Kanue
_dependencies_comment: Production dependencies required for the build process

dependencies._browser_sync_comment: Live reload development server for real-time preview during development
dependencies._gulp_comment: Main build system for task automation and file processing
dependencies._gulp_concat_comment: Concatenates multiple JavaScript files into a single file for better performance
dependencies._gulp_csso_comment: CSS minification and optimization tool to reduce file sizes
dependencies._gulp_plumber_comment: Error handling plugin that prevents Gulp from crashing on build errors
dependencies._gulp_sass_comment: SCSS compilation plugin for converting SCSS to CSS
dependencies._gulp_uglify_comment: JavaScript minification plugin to reduce file sizes and improve performance

_devDependencies_comment: Development-only dependencies not included in production build

devDependencies._sass_comment: Dart Sass compiler required by gulp-sass for SCSS compilation

_build_process_comment: The build process works as follows:
_build_steps: 1. SCSS files in src/styles/ are compiled to CSS using gulp-sass and Dart Sass
2. JavaScript files in src/js/ are concatenated and minified using gulp-concat and gulp-uglify
3. Images in src/img/ are copied to assets/img/ directory
4. Jekyll processes all templates and generates static HTML in _site/ directory
5. Browser-sync serves the site and provides live reload during development
